[File: aptos-core/consensus/consensus-types/src/proof_of_store.rs] [Impl: TDataInfo for ProofOfStore] [Signer Ordering Dependency] Does the signers() implementation's dependency on ordered_authors create vulnerabilities if the author list is manipulated or inconsistent across validators? (High)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/consensus-types/src/proof_of_store.rs] [Derive: Serialize/Deserialize for BatchInfo] [Deserialization Validation] Does BCS deserialization validate that epoch, expiration, num_txns, num_bytes are within reasonable ranges or can attackers craft malicious payloads with extreme values? (High)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/consensus-types/src/proof_of_store.rs] [Derive: Serialize/Deserialize for BatchInfoExt] [Enum Variant Attack] Can attackers craft serialized data with invalid enum discriminants to create BatchInfoExt instances in undefined states? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/consensus-types/src/proof_of_store.rs] [Derive: Serialize/Deserialize for SignedBatchInfo] [Signature Deserialization] Does deserializing SignatureWithStatus validate the signature format, or can malformed signatures be deserialized and only caught during verification? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/consensus-types/src/proof_of_store.rs] [Derive: Serialize/Deserialize for ProofOfStore] [AggregateSignature Validation] When deserializing AggregateSignature, is there validation that the aggregated signature is well-formed and not corrupted? (High)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/consensus-types/src/proof_of_store.rs] [Derive: Hash for BatchInfo] [Hash Collision Resistance] Does the derived Hash implementation provide sufficient collision resistance for BatchInfo to be used safely in HashMaps without key collisions? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/consensus-types/src/proof_of_store.rs] [Derive: CryptoHash for BatchInfo] [Deterministic Hashing] Is CryptoHash guaranteed to be deterministic across all validators regardless of endianness or platform differences? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/consensus-types/src/proof_of_store.rs] [Derive: PartialEq/Eq for BatchInfo] [Equality Bypass] Can attackers exploit floating point comparison issues or other equality edge cases to create distinct BatchInfo objects that compare as equal? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/consensus-types/src/proof_of_store.rs] [Impl: Display for BatchInfo] [Information Disclosure] Does the Display implementation leak sensitive information (author, batch_id, digest) in logs that could be exploited by attackers? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/consensus-types/src/proof_of_store.rs] [Struct: BatchInfo] [Batch ID Collision] Can attackers generate colliding batch_ids to replace legitimate batches or confuse batch tracking in the quorum store? (High)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/consensus-types/src/proof_of_store.rs] [Struct: BatchInfo] [Digest Validation] Is there enforcement that digest actually represents the hash of batch contents, or can validators propose batches with arbitrary digests? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/consensus-types/src/proof_of_store.rs] [Function: BatchInfo::size()] [Size Calculation Overflow] Can the combination of num_txns and num_bytes overflow when used in size calculations in PayloadTxnsSize::new()? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/consensus-types/src/proof_of_store.rs] [Type: ProofCache] [Cache Size Limit] Is there a maximum size for the ProofCache to prevent memory exhaustion attacks from validators creating unlimited unique batches? (High)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/consensus-types/src/proof_of_store.rs] [Type: ProofCache] [Cache Eviction Policy] Does mini_moka::sync::Cache have secure eviction policies or can attackers force eviction of important proofs causing re-verification overhead? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/consensus-types/src/proof_of_store.rs] [Type: ProofCache] [Concurrent Access] Is the Cache thread-safe for concurrent reads/writes during signature verification from multiple threads? (High)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/consensus-types/src/proof_of_store.rs] [Enum: SignedBatchInfoError] [Error Information Leakage] Do error variants like WrongInfo reveal internal state that could help attackers craft targeted attacks? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/consensus-types/src/proof_of_store.rs] [Enum: SignedBatchInfoError] [Error Handling Completeness] Are all possible verification failure modes covered by error variants or could some failures be silently ignored? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/consensus-types/src/proof_of_store.rs] [Function: SignedBatchInfo::verify()] [ValidatorVerifier Dependency] If ValidatorVerifier is compromised or has bugs, can this lead to accepting invalid signatures despite correct verify() implementation? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/consensus-types/src/proof_of_store.rs] [Function: ProofOfStore::verify()] [verify_multi_signatures Security] Does validator.verify_multi_signatures() properly check that signatures meet quorum requirements (>2/3 validator stake)? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/consensus-types/src/proof_of_store.rs] [Function: ProofOfStore::verify()] [BLS Signature Security] Are BLS12-381 aggregate signatures vulnerable to rogue key attacks where an attacker can create signatures without knowing all private keys? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/consensus-types/src/proof_of_store.rs] [Trait: TBatchInfo] [Trait Implementation Security] Can different implementations of TBatchInfo provide inconsistent values leading to consensus disagreement between validators? (High)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/consensus-types/src/proof_of_store.rs] [Trait: TDataInfo] [Info Extraction] Does the info() method guarantee immutability of returned BatchInfo, or can external code modify it causing signature mismatches? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/consensus-types/src/proof_of_store.rs] [Function: BatchInfo::epoch()] [Epoch Overflow] Can epoch values approach u64::MAX causing overflow in epoch increment operations during consensus? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/consensus-types/src/proof_of_store.rs] [Function: BatchInfo::expiration()] [Expiration Wraparound] If expiration is set near u64::MAX, can time comparisons wrap around causing expired batches to appear unexpired? (High)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/consensus-types/src/proof_of_store.rs] [Function: BatchInfo::num_txns()] [Transaction Count Limits] Is there validation that num_txns doesn't exceed block size limits, or can attackers claim impossibly large transaction counts? (High)
